text: "Ghosts" is a song by American singer Michael Jackson, released in 1997 as part of the soundtrack for the short film of the same name. It was released as part of "HIStory" / "Ghosts", a double A-side single with remixes of the song "HIStory" from Jackson's 1995 album as the second single from Blood on the Dance Floor: HIStory in the Mix. The song features a blend of pop and rock elements and showcases Jackson's signature vocal style and impressive dance moves. The short film "Ghosts" was directed by special effects wizard Stan Winston and served as a vehicle for Jackson's theatrical performances, featuring him in multiple roles, including that of a ghostly character. The narrative revolves around themes of fear, acceptance, and the supernatural. The song and the film highlight Michael Jackson's creativity and artistry, combining music, dance, and visual effects. "Ghosts" is often noted for its Halloween theme, making it a popular choice during the spooky season. It was also one of the last singles released during Jackson's lifetime, showcasing his enduring influence in the music industry. Category:1997 songs
